keywords.indexterm: Configure the interface (Change interface colors) (Change color theme) Accessibility

body.p: This preferences page contains various options that allow you to change the appearance of the user interface of . To configure the Appearance options, and go to Appearance .

The following options are available in the Appearance preferences page:
Look and Feel This option allows you to change the graphic style (look and feel) of the user interface. Depending on the operating system, you can choose between various predefined style options.
Theme This option allows you to choose between predefined color themes that will be applied over the entire user interface. You can also change various appearance related options in other preference pages for the selected theme by clicking on the various links in this section. The result of the applied modifications is displayed in the XML Syntax Highlight Preview area.In Windows, if the Look and Feel and Theme options are set to their default values, inherits the high contrast theme colors that are set in the operating system.In MAC OS X (starting with Yosemite), if you choose Graphite for the Theme, it is recommended that you enable the Use dark menu and Dock option that is found in System Preferences General .
Reset Resets the theme to its default values (this option is available when the theme is modified).
Rename Changes the name of the theme (not available for default or predefined themes).
Delete Removes the selected theme (not available for default or predefined themes).
Import Imports a new theme from an XML theme file.
Export Exports the current theme into an XML theme file.
